item.title: L3 - Working With Radicals
item.description: Notes Important Terms Radical: The symbol ​ Radicand: Number or expression under the radical Perfect Square: A Number in which the root is a whole number Simplifying and Rationalizing ...

item.title: L4 - Solving Quadratic Equations
item.description: 3 Solutions of a Quadratic Equation When we solve an equation, we are trying to to find the values of x that make MG = MD. For a quadratic function, this means the values of x that render the equation equal to 0.

item.title: L5 - Determining Quadratic Equation with intercepts
L6 - System of Equations
item.description: What is a system of equations? A system of functions is composed of functions that share the same variables. Solving systems of equations Substitution or elimination Factorize and solve for x Substitute x and solve for y values .

item.title: L4 - Translations
item.description: Vertical Translations In general, for y=f(x)+c: If c>0, there is a vertical translation of c units upwards. If c<0, there is a vertical translation of c units downwards.

item.title: L5 - Reflections
item.description: Reflections on the x-axis In general, for y=−f(x): There is a reflection the x axis if: The point (x,y) of f(x) becomes the point (x,−y). The graph of y=−f(x) is congruent to the graph of y=f(x).
